Package eu.fbk.st.server.admin

Class AdminController

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.st.server.admin.AdminController
  • public class AdminController
extends java.lang.Object
    The list of APIs for the administrator. Authentication can be done with: - session cookie (from WEB APP) - username and password (API) Authentication HTTP header - OAuth token NOT SUPPORTED YET APIs return JSONs only

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static spark.Route handleAddRole
      POST | this is the endpoint handler for adding a role Parameters: "roleName" the name of the role to add
      static spark.Route handleAddUser
      POST | this is the endpoint handler for adding a user Parameters: "username" the name of the user to add
      static spark.Route handleAssignPermissionToRole
      POST | this is the endpoint handler for assigning a permission to a role (we are CREATING a relationship element) Parameters: "roleName" the name of the role that is being given the permission over the file "fileName" the name of the related file or resource "permission" the name of the permission that is to be given to the role
      static spark.Route handleAssignUserToRole
      POST | this is the endpoint handler for assigning a user to a role (we are CREATING a relationship element) Parameters: "username" the name of the user to assign to the role "roleName" the name of the role to be assigned to the user
      static spark.Route handleDeleteFile
      DELETE | this is the endpoint handler for deleting a file Parameters: "fileName" the name of the file to delete
      static spark.Route handleDeleteRole
      DELETE | this is the endpoint handler for deleting a role Parameters: "roleName" the name of the role to delete
      static spark.Route handleDeleteUser
      DELETE | this is the endpoint handler for deleting a user Parameters: "username" the name of the user to delete
      static spark.Route handleInitializeAdminInTheCloud
      POST | this is the endpoint handler for initializing the admin BOTH in the cloud and as a user (in the context of this server) (we are CREATING a relationship element) Parameters: "publicKey" the public key of the admin "privateKey" the private key of the admin
      static spark.Route handleRevokePermissionFromRole
      DELETE | this is the endpoint handler for revoking a permission from a role (we are DELETING a relationship element) Parameters: "roleName" the name of the role that is being revoked the permission over the file "fileName" the name of the related file or resource "permission" the name of the permission that is to be revoked from the role
      static spark.Route handleRevokeUserFromRole
      DELETE | this is the endpoint handler for revoking a user from a role (we are DELETING a relationship element) Parameters: "username" the name of the user to revoke from the role "roleName" the name of the role that the user is to be revoked from

      AdminController()
